9 namespace Halide {
10 struct TestResult {
11  std::string op;
12  std::string error_msg;
13 };

15 struct Task {
16  std::string op;
17  std::string name;
18  int vector_width;
19  Expr expr;
20 };
21 
22 class SimdOpCheckTest {
23 public:
24  std::string filter{"*"};
25  std::string output_directory{Internal::get_test_tmp_dir()};
26  std::vector<Task> tasks;
27 
28  Target target;
29 
30  ImageParam in_f32{Float(32), 1, "in_f32"};
31  ImageParam in_f64{Float(64), 1, "in_f64"};
32  ImageParam in_bf16{BFloat(16), 1, "in_bf16"};
33  ImageParam in_i8{Int(8), 1, "in_i8"};
34  ImageParam in_u8{UInt(8), 1, "in_u8"};
35  ImageParam in_i16{Int(16), 1, "in_i16"};
36  ImageParam in_u16{UInt(16), 1, "in_u16"};
37  ImageParam in_i32{Int(32), 1, "in_i32"};
38  ImageParam in_u32{UInt(32), 1, "in_u32"};
39  ImageParam in_i64{Int(64), 1, "in_i64"};
40  ImageParam in_u64{UInt(64), 1, "in_u64"};
41 
42  const std::vector<ImageParam> image_params{in_f32, in_f64, in_bf16, in_i8, in_u8, in_i16, in_u16, in_i32, in_u32, in_i64, in_u64};
43  const std::vector<Argument> arg_types{in_f32, in_f64, in_bf16, in_i8, in_u8, in_i16, in_u16, in_i32, in_u32, in_i64, in_u64};
44  int W;
45  int H;
46 
47  SimdOpCheckTest(const Target t, int w, int h)
48  : target(t), W(w), H(h) {
49  target = target
50  .with_feature(Target::NoBoundsQuery)
51  .with_feature(Target::NoAsserts)
52  .with_feature(Target::NoRuntime)
53  .with_feature(Target::DisableLLVMLoopOpt);
54  num_threads = Internal::ThreadPool<void>::num_processors_online();
55  }
56  virtual ~SimdOpCheckTest() = default;
57  size_t get_num_threads() const {
58  return num_threads;
59  }
60 
61  void set_num_threads(size_t n) {
62  num_threads = n;
63  }
64 
65  virtual bool can_run_code() const {
66  // Assume we are configured to run wasm if requested
67  // (we'll fail further downstream if not)
68  if (target.arch == Target::WebAssembly) {
69  return true;
70  }
71  // If we can (target matches host), run the error checking Halide::Func.
72  Target host_target = get_host_target();
73  bool can_run_the_code =
74  (target.arch == host_target.arch &&
75  target.bits == host_target.bits &&
76  target.os == host_target.os);
77  // A bunch of feature flags also need to match between the
78  // compiled code and the host in order to run the code.
79  for (Target::Feature f : {Target::SSE41, Target::AVX,
80  Target::AVX2, Target::AVX512,
81  Target::FMA, Target::FMA4, Target::F16C,
82  Target::VSX, Target::POWER_ARCH_2_07,
83  Target::ARMv7s, Target::NoNEON,
84  Target::WasmSimd128}) {
85  if (target.has_feature(f) != host_target.has_feature(f)) {
86  can_run_the_code = false;
87  }
88  }
89  return can_run_the_code;
90  }
91 
92  virtual void compile_and_check(Func f, Func error, const std::string &op, const std::string &name, int vector_width, std::ostringstream &error_msg) {
93  // Compile just the vector Func to assembly.
94  std::string asm_filename = output_directory + "check_" + name + ".s";
95  f.compile_to_assembly(asm_filename, arg_types, target);
96 
97  std::ifstream asm_file;
98  asm_file.open(asm_filename);
99 
100  bool found_it = false;
101 
102  std::ostringstream msg;
103  msg << op << " did not generate for target=" << target.to_string() << " vector_width=" << vector_width << ". Instead we got:\n";
104 
105  std::string line;
106  while (getline(asm_file, line)) {
107  msg << line << "\n";
108 
109  // Check for the op in question
110  found_it |= wildcard_search(op, line) && !wildcard_search("_" + op, line);
111  }
112 
113  if (!found_it) {
114  error_msg << "Failed: " << msg.str() << "\n";
115  }
116 
117  asm_file.close();
118 
119  // Also compile the error checking Func (to be sure it compiles without error)
120  std::string fn_name = "test_" + name;
121  error.compile_to_file(output_directory + fn_name, arg_types, fn_name, target);
122  }
123 
124  // Check if pattern p matches str, allowing for wildcards (*).
125  bool wildcard_match(const char *p, const char *str) const {
126  // Match all non-wildcard characters.
127  while (*p && *str && *p == *str && *p != '*') {
128  str++;
129  p++;
130  }
131 
132  if (!*p) {
133  return *str == 0;
134  } else if (*p == '*') {
135  p++;
136  do {
137  if (wildcard_match(p, str)) {
138  return true;
139  }
140  } while (*str++);
141  } else if (*p == ' ') { // ignore whitespace in pattern
142  p++;
143  if (wildcard_match(p, str)) {
144  return true;
145  }
146  } else if (*str == ' ') { // ignore whitespace in string
147  str++;
148  if (wildcard_match(p, str)) {
149  return true;
150  }
151  }
152  return !*p;
153  }
154 
155  bool wildcard_match(const std::string &p, const std::string &str) const {
156  return wildcard_match(p.c_str(), str.c_str());
157  }
158 
159  // Check if a substring of str matches a pattern p.
160  bool wildcard_search(const std::string &p, const std::string &str) const {
161  return wildcard_match("*" + p + "*", str);
162  }
163 
164  TestResult check_one(const std::string &op, const std::string &name, int vector_width, Expr e) {
165  std::ostringstream error_msg;
166 
167  class HasInlineReduction : public Internal::IRVisitor {
168  using Internal::IRVisitor::visit;
169  void visit(const Internal::Call *op) override {
170  if (op->call_type == Internal::Call::Halide) {
171  Internal::Function f(op->func);
172  if (f.has_update_definition()) {
173  inline_reduction = f;
174  result = true;
175  }
176  }
177  IRVisitor::visit(op);
178  }
179 
180  public:
181  Internal::Function inline_reduction;
182  bool result = false;
183  } has_inline_reduction;
184  e.accept(&has_inline_reduction);
185 
186  // Define a vectorized Halide::Func that uses the pattern.
187  Halide::Func f(name);
188  f(x, y) = e;
189  f.bound(x, 0, W).vectorize(x, vector_width);
190  f.compute_root();
191 
192  // Include a scalar version
193  Halide::Func f_scalar("scalar_" + name);
194  f_scalar(x, y) = e;
195  f_scalar.bound(x, 0, W);
196  f_scalar.compute_root();
197 
198  if (has_inline_reduction.result) {
199  // If there's an inline reduction, we want to vectorize it
200  // over the RVar.
201  Var xo, xi;
202  RVar rxi;
203  Func g{has_inline_reduction.inline_reduction};
204 
205  // Do the reduction separately in f_scalar
206  g.clone_in(f_scalar);
207 
208  g.compute_at(f, x)
209  .update()
210  .split(x, xo, xi, vector_width)
211  .atomic()
212  .vectorize(g.rvars()[0])
213  .vectorize(xi);
214  }
215 
216  // The output to the pipeline is the maximum absolute difference as a double.
217  RDom r_check(0, W, 0, H);
218  Halide::Func error("error_" + name);
219  error() = Halide::cast<double>(maximum(absd(f(r_check.x, r_check.y), f_scalar(r_check.x, r_check.y))));
220 
221  setup_images();
222  compile_and_check(f, error, op, name, vector_width, error_msg);
223 
224  bool can_run_the_code = can_run_code();
225  if (can_run_the_code) {
226  Target run_target = target
227  .without_feature(Target::NoRuntime)
228  .without_feature(Target::NoAsserts)
229  .without_feature(Target::NoBoundsQuery);
230 
231  error.infer_input_bounds({}, run_target);
232  // Fill the inputs with noise
233  std::mt19937 rng(123);
234  for (auto p : image_params) {
235  Halide::Buffer<> buf = p.get();
236  if (!buf.defined()) continue;
237  assert(buf.data());
238  Type t = buf.type();
239  // For floats/doubles, we only use values that aren't
240  // subject to rounding error that may differ between
241  // vectorized and non-vectorized versions
242  if (t == Float(32)) {
243  buf.as<float>().for_each_value([&](float &f) { f = (rng() & 0xfff) / 8.0f - 0xff; });
244  } else if (t == Float(64)) {
245  buf.as<double>().for_each_value([&](double &f) { f = (rng() & 0xfff) / 8.0 - 0xff; });
246  } else {
247  // Random bits is fine
248  for (uint32_t *ptr = (uint32_t *)buf.data();
249  ptr != (uint32_t *)buf.data() + buf.size_in_bytes() / 4;
250  ptr++) {
251  // Never use the top four bits, to avoid
252  // signed integer overflow.
253  *ptr = ((uint32_t)rng()) & 0x0fffffff;
254  }
255  }
256  }
257  Realization r = error.realize();
258  double e = Buffer<double>(r[0])();
259  // Use a very loose tolerance for floating point tests. The
260  // kinds of bugs we're looking for are codegen bugs that
261  // return the wrong value entirely, not floating point
262  // accuracy differences between vectors and scalars.
263  if (e > 0.001) {
264  error_msg << "The vector and scalar versions of " << name << " disagree. Maximum error: " << e << "\n";
265 
266  std::string error_filename = output_directory + "error_" + name + ".s";
267  error.compile_to_assembly(error_filename, arg_types, target);
268 
269  std::ifstream error_file;
270  error_file.open(error_filename);
271 
272  error_msg << "Error assembly: \n";
273  std::string line;
274  while (getline(error_file, line)) {
275  error_msg << line << "\n";
276  }
277 
278  error_file.close();
279  }
280  }
281 
282  return {op, error_msg.str()};
283  }
284 
285  void check(std::string op, int vector_width, Expr e) {
286  // Make a name for the test by uniquing then sanitizing the op name
287  std::string name = "op_" + op;
288  for (size_t i = 0; i < name.size(); i++) {
289  if (!isalnum(name[i])) name[i] = '_';
290  }
291 
292  name += "_" + std::to_string(tasks.size());
293 
294  // Bail out after generating the unique_name, so that names are
295  // unique across different processes and don't depend on filter
296  // settings.
297  if (!wildcard_match(filter, op)) return;
298 
299  tasks.emplace_back(Task{op, name, vector_width, e});
300  }
301  virtual void add_tests() = 0;
302  virtual void setup_images() {
303  for (auto p : image_params) {
304  p.reset();
305  }
306  }
307  virtual bool test_all() {
308  /* First add some tests based on the target */
309  add_tests();
310  Internal::ThreadPool<TestResult> pool(num_threads);
311  std::vector<std::future<TestResult>> futures;
312  for (const Task &task : tasks) {
313  futures.push_back(pool.async([this, task]() {
314  return check_one(task.op, task.name, task.vector_width, task.expr);
315  }));
316  }
317 
318  bool success = true;
319  for (auto &f : futures) {
320  const TestResult &result = f.get();
321  std::cout << result.op << "\n";
322  if (!result.error_msg.empty()) {
323  std::cerr << result.error_msg;
324  success = false;
325  }
326  }
327 
328  return success;
329  }
330 
331 private:
332  size_t num_threads;
333  const Halide::Var x{"x"}, y{"y"};
334 };
335 } // namespace Halide
336 #endif // SIMD_OP_CHECK_H
